content: As the real-world numbers start to build, lessons learned from the KidneyIntelX implementations at Mount Sinai, Wake Forest, Atrium Health, CDPHP, and now the Veterans Health Administration System are setting the foundation for a national model with the potential to enable a broad section of healthcare providers to drive better outcomes for the greater than 12 million people with diabetic kidney disease in the United States. From the start, we were aware that others have tried to apply broad care solutions in chronic disease based on their technology solution. From the start, we were aware that others have tried to apply broad care solutions in chronic disease based on their technology solution.
